sections.title: Income Assessment
sections.help_text: We'll review your Social Security, pension, and any other income you have coming in each month. Once we've got that, I'll help you figure out what's available for care costs.

info_boxes.message: üí° You can save and come back anytime. Your progress is automatically tracked.

sections.title: Social Security Benefits
sections.help_text: Monthly Social Security retirement or disability benefits

fields.label: Social Security Monthly Benefit
fields.help: Enter the monthly Social Security benefit amount

info_boxes.message: üìä When to claim: Age 62 (reduced) vs. 66-67 (full) vs. 70 (max benefit, up to 30% more). Spousal benefits: Up to 50% of spouse's benefit if higher than your own. Average 2024: $1,907/month (retirement), $1,537/month (disability).

fields.label: Monthly Pension/Annuity Income
fields.help: Monthly pension or annuity income (combined total)

info_boxes.message: üíº Lump sum vs. monthly: Weigh guaranteed income vs. flexibility. Survivor benefits: Choose the right option to protect your spouse's income. Value: Lifetime guaranteed income is valuable for care planning.

sections.title: Employment Income
sections.help_text: Income from current employment or self-employment

info_boxes.message: ‚ö†Ô∏è Social Security impact: Earnings above $22,320 (2024) may reduce SS benefits if claiming before full retirement age. Part-time work provides income plus social engagement.

sections.title: Other Income Sources
sections.help_text: Family support, trust distributions, VA benefits, etc.

fields.label: Other Monthly Income
fields.help: Family support, trust distributions, VA benefits, or other income

info_boxes.message: üí° Examples: Family support from adult children, trust distributions, VA Aid & Attendance ($2,431/month in 2024), reverse mortgage payments (age 62+).
